intro: Psychotria tobagensis, commonly known as the Toba psychotria, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean, particularly found in the islands of Trinidad and Tobago. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, green leaves and clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Despite its modest appearance, it plays a role in local ecosystems and has been studied for its chemical composition.
